Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\grid\GridView

All Classes | Properties | Methods | Constants
Inheritanceyii\grid\GridView » yii\widgets\BaseListView » yii\base\Widget » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable, yii\base\ViewContextInterface
Available since version2.0
Source Code
The GridView widget is used to display data in a grid.

It provides features like sorting, paging and also filtering the data.

Property Details

$options property
array $options = ['class' => 'grid-view']

The HTML attributes for the container tag of the grid view. The "tag" element specifies the tag name of the container element and defaults to "div".

$showOnEmpty property
boolean $showOnEmpty = true

Whether to show the grid view if $dataProvider returns no data.

$dataColumnClass property
string $dataColumnClass = null

The default data column class if the class name is not explicitly specified when configuring a data column. Defaults to 'yii\grid\DataColumn'.

$caption property
string $caption = null

The caption of the grid table

See Also

  • $captionOptions
$captionOptions property
array $captionOptions = []

The HTML attributes for the caption element

See Also

  • $caption
$tableOptions property
array $tableOptions = ['class' => 'table table-striped table-bordered']

The HTML attributes for the grid table element

$headerRowOptions property
array $headerRowOptions = []

The HTML attributes for the table header row

$footerRowOptions property
array $footerRowOptions = []

The HTML attributes for the table footer row

$rowOptions property
array|\Closure $rowOptions = []

The HTML attributes for the table body rows. This can be either an array specifying the common HTML attributes for all body rows, or an anonymous function that returns an array of the HTML attributes. The anonymous function will be called once for every data model returned by $dataProvider. It should have the following signature:

function ($model, $key, $index, $grid)
  • $model: the current data model being rendered
  • $key: the key value associated with the current data model
  • $index: the zero-based index of the data model in the model array returned by $dataProvider
  • $grid: the GridView object

$beforeRow property
\Closure $beforeRow = null

An anonymous function that is called once BEFORE rendering each data model. It should have the similar signature as $rowOptions. The return result of the function will be rendered directly.

$afterRow property
\Closure $afterRow = null

An anonymous function that is called once AFTER rendering each data model. It should have the similar signature as $rowOptions. The return result of the function will be rendered directly.

$showHeader property
boolean $showHeader = true

Whether to show the header section of the grid table.

$showFooter property
boolean $showFooter = false

Whether to show the footer section of the grid table.

$formatter property
array|yii\base\Formatter $formatter = null

The formatter used to format model attribute values into displayable texts. This can be either an instance of yii\base\Formatter or an configuration array for creating the yii\base\Formatter instance. If this property is not set, the "formatter" application component will be used.

$columns property
array $columns = []

Grid column configuration. Each array element represents the configuration for one particular grid column. For example,

[
    ['class' => SerialColumn::className()],
    [
        'class' => DataColumn::className(),
        'attribute' => 'name',
        'format' => 'text',
        'label' => 'Name',
    ],
    ['class' => CheckboxColumn::className()],
]

If a column is of class yii\grid\DataColumn, the "class" element can be omitted. As a shortcut format, a string may be used to specify the configuration of a data column which only contains "attribute", "format", and/or "label" options: "attribute:format:label". For example, the above "name" column can also be specified as: "name:text:Name". Both "format" and "label" are optional. They will take default values if absent.

$emptyCell property
$emptyCell = ' '

$filterModel property
yii\base\Model $filterModel = null

The model that keeps the user-entered filter data. When this property is set, the grid view will enable column-based filtering. Each data column by default will display a text field at the top that users can fill in to filter the data. Note that in order to show an input field for filtering, a column must have its yii\grid\DataColumn::$attribute property set or have yii\grid\DataColumn::$filter set as the HTML code for the input field. When this property is not set (null) the filtering feature is disabled.

$filterUrl property
string|array $filterUrl = null

The URL for returning the filtering result. yii\helpers\Html::url() will be called to normalize the URL. If not set, the current controller action will be used. When the user makes change to any filter input, the current filtering inputs will be appended as GET parameters to this URL.

$filterSelector property
$filterSelector = null

$filterPosition property
string $filterPosition = self::FILTER_POS_BODY

Whether the filters should be displayed in the grid view. Valid values include: - FILTER_POS_HEADER: the filters will be displayed on top of each column's header cell. - FILTER_POS_BODY: the filters will be displayed right below each column's header cell. - FILTER_POS_FOOTER: the filters will be displayed below each column's footer cell.

$filterRowOptions property
array $filterRowOptions = ['class' => 'filters']

The HTML attributes for the filter row element

$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

string getId( $autoGenerate = true )
void setId( $value )

ID of the widget.

yii\web\View getView( )
void setView( $view )

the view object that can be used to render views or view files.

the directory containing the view files for this widget.
